thread.title: Armed robbery highlights bigger issue for Algiers residents
thread.title_full: Armed robbery highlights bigger issue for Algiers residents - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: Written by: Greg Adaline, Anchor
title: Armed robbery highlights bigger issue for Algiers residents
text:
ALGIERS, LA (WVUE) - The armed robbery of three skateboarders may stand out to some, but neighbors say the crime is par for the course in Algiers.
According to NOPD, the three victims, all in their late-teens and early-20s, were skateboarding in the 4500 block of General Meyers around 6:30 p.m. on Oct. 13 when two men approached them. One of the men pulled out a semi-automatic handgun and forced them to lie down and empty their pockets.
The two armed men then took the skateboarder's belongings and fled the scene in an unidentified vehicle according to NOPD.
Word of the armed robbery didn’t surprise neighbors. One couple we spoke with said that their home has been vandalized and broken into numerous times, making crime like this par for the course.
Kathryn Gibson, an Algiers resident, said that people are fed up.
“People here are moving out,” Gibson said. “They got for sale signs all over the place. People are just getting out of here.”
NOPD officials say arrests have been made as of Wednesday morning. Fox 8 will update this story as more information becomes available.
